subtitle.Text: Steve: Oh! You found an easter egg!
Karla: Who found it?!
Steve and Karla: You found it!!
Steve: This is the best! You looked up! No one in a first person game looks up!
Karla: Because there’s no rewards to looking up.
Steve: Because it’s hard to look up, of all things.
Karla: Also you weren’t allowed to look up in like…
Steve and Karla: Wolfenstein??
Steve: And Doom. It shot higher if there was an enemy higher.
Karla: Oh, yeah.
Steve: If you go get something recycleable from the recycle bin I made it so that when you throw it, you throw it way further than a normal thing
and you can knock the basketball out of the rafters and then carry it to Sam’s room, and then when you make a basket, either by just throwing it through or by dunking -
Karla: You get a present!
Steve: You get a present which is pictures of our cats showing up on the television…
Karla: And cats that we know.
Steve: Cats and friends of cats.
Karla: Yeah, cat fr - sure.

Steve: And we also, we did a final wrap up, like a pickup voice recording session with Sarah Grayson, and we just went in there to re-record a couple of lines because we wanted to go a different direction with them
after we’d put them in the game and listened to them and everything, and we had some extra time and it was like, what are we going to do with this extra time and we didn’t know,
and then we were like, we did want to make an easter egg, what if you just reread one of the audio diaries but instead of words you said ‘meow’? And she was like… okaaay.
Karla: If you say so! And she was game as hell.
Steve: So we went back in and she was a champ and did it perfectly -
Karla: Did not break face.
Steve: No, and Josh, our audio engineer I think just had no idea what the hell was going on. And yeah, at the end of the audio diary,
when you make the basket in Sam’s room you can hear, from outside the booth, us starting to laugh before the audio cuts off.
Karla: It’s a beauty.
Steve: Yeah, easter eggs are fun, and again, congratulations for looking up.
